reviews.title: positive
reviews.text: Basically I enjoyed this trip. It is more or less authentic experience you can find in the area. You can enjoy sincere and a little naive culture of the 'inner people', listen to their music and watch traditional dances and games. These people, of course, are just actors to satisfy the needs of visitors for smth exotic, but still they show their true arts.  If you have no chance to go to the inner areas and spend quite a lot of money to stay in a real village with dayak people, the visit to Pampang will be a marvelous choice for you. The only shade of scepticism was spilled on me with too much interaction with visitors, again to satisfy their needs for exotic things. But this is forgettable regarding to thje major part of the action. It is definitely worth visiting.

reviews.title: Dayak Culture Village
reviews.text: I came here in one day before Lebaran 2019, so no much tourist. Even its not Sunday, so I am not seeing any regular dance. This place need several rehabilitation. I still see the garbage, I think the tours will not like it.

reviews.title: One of cultural tradition place need to concerned
reviews.text:
This place only crowed on sunday but lucky me even on Tuesday i could met the dayak oldmen with the long ear and dayak little girl who will dancing.
Unfortunately in here its all bout the money. When u want to take a picture with dayak we have to pay, when we want to make the little girl dancing we have to pay.... may be its already a tradition there but thos place very authentic n must be concern by the goverment so we could keep the tradition

reviews.title: Good Show and Cultural Market
reviews.text:
The show is only held on Sunday at 2 pm and finishes around 3.30 - 4 pm.
The fee is RP 20,000 per person which is paid at the car entrance.
I recommend to come earlier because the seat is fully booked and most of the people take videos. So it is quite annoying if we sit behind.

There were around 10 dances. It was a slow dance and they play local instruments.
The girls and the costumes are pretty.
They also involve the audiences to dance with them.

To take photos with the elderly, we pay RP 25,000 and with the kids, we pay RP 20,000
I recommend to directly go to these kids to take photos, instead of buying tickets for the photo session.

For the shops outside the hall, remember to bargain.

reviews.title: Dayak Village
reviews.text:
Ok, I have been lived in Samarinda almost 1 year and I want to go to this village. It took about 40 minutes ride by motorcycle from my home to this village. You can see about 9 dances but you have to pay first to see this dances but it worth to pay. This show start on Sunday 02.00 PM.
Recommended place to go when you go to Samarinda, I mean you must go to this place when you visiting Samarinda

reviews.title: Entertaining but lack of facility
reviews.text:
We visited Pampang on Monday, December 31st, 2017. The dance starts at 2 pm, but it is better to arrive before 1:30 pm to get best spot.
The facility is very minimum, I hope the government can give an attention to elevate the level of the show.

reviews.title: Must visit
reviews.text: If you want to see dayak culture you should come to pampang. It open every day but the show only on sunday at 14.00 but you should come earlier because it always full.

reviews.title: Lets visit !!
reviews.text: I have been there twice,  if you want to come then better  on sunday, they have some traditional dance 02:00 PM, you can enjoy the dance and taking photos with old man who have a long ear, and the dancer, its so cute with lil dancer ( absolutely after the show ) ticket 20.000 rupias / person. Taking photos you need to pay 25.000 (4 frame ) .  If you want then you can rent their traditional dance, 50.000 rupias...

reviews.title: Seeing Dayak community new year celebration
reviews.text:
Managed to come here on monday, and think there will be no event or something as it was Monday. But when I arrived, apparently they have a new year event that is still on going. Although it is quite late (already afternoon), but I still able to see some dances by local people. 
I got the picture with elder guy from the tribe. Very nice to know Dayak people and culture.

reviews.title: One place to see dayak traditional dance
reviews.text: This place look like another common indonesian village. The dancing show start at 3.00 pm every sunday. Come early if you dont wanna miss the show, and sit in the front row. Visitor can also participate in several dance with the native people.

reviews.title: This is awesome \0/
reviews.text:
You can use waze or google map to guide you to the location but direction sign are there also. It only takes 5 minutes from samarinda city. No need to hike, the dayak cultural park located beside the road. The dayak house also located beside the car park. They only charge 15000 rupiah each person.

About 10 dayak dances are in display. The show is on sunday at 2 until 3 pm. DON"T BE LATE!!! Some of the dances are interactive. You can join the dancers and learn.

After the show, you can rent their traditional clothing and take pictures with them. But they will charge you for the pictures.

reviews.title: Love the culture and Dayak people was very humble and keep the tradition
reviews.text:
This is my first time go to the Pampang at Sei Siring Samarinda. Sei is the similar with river. In this place we can see the Traditional dance and cultural of Suku Dayak Kalimantan. 
It was amazing how the tradition they have been keeping for long time ago, as you can see in my picture one of them have long ear which is showing the honor. Such a lovely place & people

reviews.title: Dayak culture
reviews.text: Firstly I thought the like a real village with kind of their house and so on, but I got wrong, this place only for show to public about the dayaj culture. Very interesting culture n the dance. Nice place to visit n not far from samarinda

reviews.title: A Little Peak to Dayak Culture
reviews.text:
at First, I was assumed this village similar to Baduy but I've Got It Wrong. The village just a little bit modern compare to original dayak in Hulu. The attraction held in a building who called Lamin (or Big house). There are 10 kind of dayak dances that will be performed by local people. 

After the show, the visitor can take a picture with the dancer but we have to pay. it's a little annoying the kids begging for money eventhough we are not take picture with them. It's not good for the kids personality development. But overall this actractions is good for cultural lover..

The Entry Ticket price is IDR 15,000 . I think it's cheap. They have to increased the price but resctricted the performers especially the kids to ask money to visitor.

reviews.title: Family trip
reviews.text:
The place is about 15 kilo from samarinda city, and the access wasn't so hard. In pampang you can see their performance only in sunday 2pm. 
They sell accessories like bracelet, hat, neckles. 
You can take pictures with dayak childrens and the elder.

reviews.title: Exotic Culture
reviews.text:
The village is designated as a cultural heritage area which shows art and culture by local governments, and the residence of Dayak Kenyah community. 
When you visit the area, you will find the strength of tradition and value-nalai are held by society.

reviews.title: Interesting to know Dayak culture
reviews.text: It's located 1 hour from samarinda city. It is dayak ethnic village. This is a cultural show of Dayak cultures from games, dances. We can meet the older Dayak community and the kids, all wearing traditional clothes. In the end of the show we can take photos with them. The cultures are very interesting and the shows are pleasantly entertaining.

reviews.title: The Dayak tribe village
reviews.text: this place is around 25 km from the Samarinda city and this village have the attraction such as dancing and one of famous Dayak heritage village

reviews.title: Great heritage, great performance
reviews.text:
When you are in Samarinda on Sunday, don't miss this village. It's one of Dayak Kenyah heritage village which is well preserved. Every Sunday 2pm-4pm there will be dancing performance in their traditional long house. It costs you admission fee of 15.000 rupiahs per person. After the performance, you can take pictures with the kids or the elder Dayaks which will cost you another 25.000 rupiahs per shot. Look for the famous long ear woman, she might be the last Dayak woman with long ears; if you can't find her in the longhouse, look around, she might be mingling with other women selling souvenirs in the stalls in front of the house.

It's quite far to get here from the main road so you'd better take ojek (motor taxi) from the main gate.  If you are a bit more adventurous, once you pass the main gate from the main road, look on your right side. Approximately 1 KM you will see a real traditional long house with real Dayak people still living in it.

reviews.title: Cultural village
reviews.text: The Dayak tribe village....... It is one of famous Cultural village in Samarinda......... Worth to visit......it's 25 km away from the city.........drive along the bontang road.

reviews.title: Sweet Escape in Samarinda
reviews.text:
Ulin Arya is the sweetest escape from the hustle of Samarinda. The view of nature and animal playground make it more friendly with the kids and family. So many spots to taking picture, picnic or even just to sit back and relax. The air is so clean and fresh.

The location is quite far from the city but can be reached by motorcycle or car.

reviews.title: Solo, teman, keluarga bisa ke sini untuk habiskan waktu diakhir pekan.

Seru, visit sebelum pandemic sih sebenarnya. 
Sekarang sudah banyak banget perkembangan terbaru. Jangan ragu untuk ke rumah ulim arya.

reviews.title: Tempat liburan keluarga samarinda
reviews.text: Tempatnya asyik buat ngajak liburan untuk keluarga, ada mini farm, ada botanical garden, ada kolam renang nya juga.. buat gathering perusahaan juga bagus

reviews.title: Outbound Jawsika  selalu asyik bila di Rumah Ulin Arya
reviews.text: Saya Provider Outbound di kaltim. Setiap Klien minta tempat outbound yang representatif, saya selalu memberikan alternatif Rumah Ulin Arya sebagai tempat yang asyik dan menyenangkan. Banyak pilihan tempat yang bisa dipergunakan saat akan melakukan kegiatan.  Terutama halang rintang Arya dan Kolam renang kesehatan

reviews.title: Wisata Alam dan Outbound
reviews.text: Tempat rekreasi wisata keluarga yang sangat cocok untuk anak2 disini tersedia beberapa wahana untuk outbound, ada mini Zoo, terdapat cafe yg menyajikan macam2 snack dan minuman atau juice. Ada juga wahana untuk bermain anak2 dan yang paling bagus tersedia kolam renang yang bersih dan luas. Ada tempat nongkrong santai  bagi siapa saja yang menunggu para anak berenang. Recommend to visit to this place kalau ada datang ke Kota Samarinda.

reviews.title: Harus Lebih Ditingkatkan lagi!

atraksi nya sangat sedikit, hewan2 farmnya juga kurang variatif, petunjuk kurang jelas, nuntuk anak saya yang berusia 2 tahun dan sangat suka dengan binatang ini sangat tidak memuaskan. mungkin harus ditingkatkan lagi, padahal konseppnya juga sudah sangat bagus.
cafe nya LAMA. pelayanan kurang baik. bahkan kemarin saya melihat ada customer yang ngamuk karena makanannya tidak datang-datang. padalah menunya sangat sederhana harusnya tidak memakan waktu lama.

Namun, mengingat tempat ini adalah tempat peribadatan warga Budha, bagi wisatawan, dimohon aktivitas wisata kita jangan sampai mengganggu aktivitas ibadah yang tengah dilakukan.

reviews.title: positive
reviews.text: If you want authentic view on real Indonesia, you definitely need to experience a walk down from the center of Samarinda to the river. You will see the contrasts between the rich and the poor, you will see splendour and misery of the city. It is what makes true journey unforgettable. Its not what your polished consumer-oriented tours offer you for money... Highly recommended.

reviews.title: Beautiful sunrise
reviews.text: Beautiful sunrise across the river from Harris Hotel. Surreal experience watching the sunrise and coal barges streaming downriver while having breakfast.

reviews.title: 2 week trip up the Mahakam

There is such minimal info out there about this journey, so if anyone wants any info about it, email me at daynafitz97@gmail.com and I would be happy to help :)

I wish I could come again

reviews.title: Great tour with DeGigant
reviews.text:
My mother of 70 years old and I went on a 5 night / 6 days Mahakam river tour. It was a great experience :).

The Mahakam river is huge and many people will find it a little dirty. However... This is Indonesia, thing ARE a little dirty sometimes. It didn't bother us although it can be sad to see how mining and palm oil plantations deplete all the nation treasures with so many people living in poverty.

Lucas, the (Dutch) owner of DeGigant was friendly and a good communicator. I was able to book the trip from back home which was a huge bonus because we lacked time to shop around in Balikpapan. Maybe you can get it for cheaper but we were very satisfied with the quality of the boat, staff and food.

Every day we took a small motorized canoe into the smaller side rivers to go to Dayak tribes and watch wildlife. What we liked best:
1. The food. Anto, our chef was simply amazing putting together a new dish or dishes every night. Wow! A real culinary experience.
2. The guide. Jai/Janai was super friendly and knowledgeable. He knew a lot of people in the area. Good English, great guide.
3. The boat. Well maintained and for 2 people only very large. Airco at night, which was nice :). Also western toilet, shower.

The Dayak tribes & the nature was beautiful. I recommend this trip with DeGigant!

reviews.title: Welcoming and friendly Dayak villagers!
reviews.text:
My husband, adult son and I had the pleasure of joining David, the captain, cook and crew for a fabulous eight days on the Mahakam River.  
We were not looking for ‘star rated’ accommodation on the houseboat and were not disappointed.
However, beds were very comfortable. Mosquito nets provided confidence.  The bathroom was basic, and just as described.  We had a private little balcony on the top deck, just outside our sleeping cabin. We are all tall, so we spent much of our time ducking low roofs.  That was all part of the experience.  
The communal dining area was perfect.  The food was fabulous.  The staff was very supportive, friendly and courteous at all times.
We loved all our visits to the various Dayak villages.  The people we met made us feel very, very welcome.  
David was very respectful in all the villages we visited. We were lucky enough to happen upon wedding preparations in one village, where we were invited to help with the traditional feast preparations and attend the ceremony.  Sadly, we had a plane to catch the following day and could not stay long.
Thank you all for some wonderful experiences and very happy memories of our time on the Mahakam, Kalimantan.
Jill

reviews.title: Along the Mahakam River
reviews.text: 3 day and 2 night trips were very impressive, overnight on the boat, dinner menu of sea food is yummy, unforgettable experience and want to repeat again

reviews.title: The Famous River In Kalimantan
reviews.text:
It is such a huge river. The 3rd longest river in Indonesia, with 800m for the shorthest wide size of the river. This river has become the city's water supply, with its yellowish brown colour, and become one of the main water transportation to carry away coals.

Now, there is a local ship for tourist for approximately 2 hours ride watching sunsets. There is a myth about this river, once you drink the water from Mahakam river, you will repeatedly come back to Samarinda.

reviews.title: Mahakam River cruise with De'Gigant tours
reviews.text:
The crew of the boat was very friendly, the guide was nice and the cook on board was superb. We have seen a lot of the local life and enjoyed the beautiful nature. 
The minus was that our boat was broken already two hours after departure. We had to wait for a replacement boat that costed us a full day of the program. Unfortunately the owner of the Tour company, Lucas, did not want to take responsibility. That was a big disappointment. 
So please go to a tour on the Mahakam river but not with De'Gigant Tours.

reviews.title: Cruising On The Mighty Mahakam
reviews.text:
My daughter and I took a cruise of three days and two nights down the Mahakam River with DeGigant Borneo Tours. The journey began when we were picked up from our hotel in Samarinda and taken to the boat.  It was large, extremely clean, and well furnished. There was a large bedroom on top with two double mattresses, clean linen, and mosquito net. Also, plug points for charging our phones and cameras, and a viewing deck with comfortable chairs. Below there was a dining table and chairs.  Besides plentiful and varied fare for breakfast, lunch, tea and dinner, we could help ourselves to tea and coffee, fruit and biscuits at any time we felt hungry.  There was a crew of three, the Captain and his assistants, a very sweet lady who cooked really amazing meals for us, and our guide who showed us everything possible and explained everything we wanted to know about, but at the same time, allowed us our privacy, too.

We had a western style toilet to ourselves with a hygiene faucet and flush. There was also a shower and a wash basin with mirror. All the water for washing and bathing purposes came from a freshwater tank on the boat.

The first day was just a leisurely progress down the Mahakam, taking in the river life and activities on both sides  -  some of it, like the loading of giant barges with coal, a depressing reminder of how the land is being exploited of natural resources.  The boat stopped at the pretty village of Muara Muntai during the night.  In the morning our guide took us on a tour of the village which has over 30 kms of boardwalk and unexpected facilities like a school, hospital and post office.  When we returned our canoe was waiting to take us across a massive lake, through intricate channels very difficult to negotiate, to a Dayak village with the longest longhouse in the province. Our boatman was brilliant at navigating the canoe and thanks to him and our guide, we were able to see many kinds of birds, tree snakes, monitor lizards, proboscis and other monkeys, and giant squirrels. It was excitement all the way in looking out for wildlife and taking photographs.

When we reached the Dayak village, we were given a tour of the beautiful longhouse with exquisite carvings.  The Dayak tribe showed us many dances and we took part in a couple, which was great fun. We were also shown how to use an actual blowpipe to shoot arrows and then we were annointed with rice paste according to tradition.  A lovely, gentle people. They do some fine embroidery and we bought a piece for framing later on. The cook had thoughtfully packed lunch for us because by the time we made the return journey, it was late evening.  I was very impressed with the compassion of the boatman, who stopped to free a baby monkey which had been caught in a trap. 

We started the journey back, reaching our drop-off point at Tenggarong after breakfast the next morning. Our guide took us ashore to visit the Sultan's Palace which has been made into a well-planned and interesting museum. We finished our tour just before lunch time and a car was waiting to take us to Balikpapan, where we were going to spend the night.

We thoroughly enjoyed the cruise and besides hundreds of photos we have happy memories of the lovely people we met.

reviews.title: Culture in Transition
reviews.text:
My daughter and I recently took an 8-day, 7 night boat trip up the Mahakam River in East Kalimintan.  We booked our trip with Didier Waegemans, a Belgian who is a partner Mundooz Borneo Adventure Tours.  Didier was very knowledgeable and helpful and promptly responded to my inquiries throughout the planning process.  He arranged the tour with De gigant Tours Borneo out of Samarinda, and fixed us up with an excellent, well-regarded guide named Jailani.  We were provided with a beautiful, spotlessly clean boat with a crew of five who took care of our every need.  The chef on board was terrific and cooked three delicious and perfectly cooked multi-course meals every day.  We had the whole top of the boat to ourselves, which included our air-conditioned bedroom with a couple of thick mattresses on the floor, and a lovely veranda at the front of the boat where we could watch the world go by.

The tour itself was fascinating, but it is not what it used to be.  Rather than seeing people living in longhouses in remote, traditional communities, these days the region is in the process of transformation.  Kalimantan provides 25% of Indonesia’s GDP and so economic migration and resource extraction are rampant.  Tugboats pull untold numbers of huge coal barges worth hundreds of thousands of dollars down river, and enormous rafts of hardwoods float downstream towards their Asian markets.  Dozens of speed boats ply the river, full of workers heading back and forth from their jobs.  The villages still process many commodities in traditional ways, including salt fish, baskets, woven cloth, wood carvings, palm sugar and sago, among others, and the processes used are astonishing to see.  Wildlife  still exists within and alongside the river, including Irrawaddy dolphins, monkeys of various kinds, and many beautiful birds.  We took a number of shorter trips in motorized canoes, which were great fun, and there was no end of interesting sites along the way.  The people were absolutely lovely, especially our guide Jailani, who has thorough knowledge of the area, as well as many relatives and friends in the various villages along the route.

We enjoyed every moment of our trip, and learned so much about Indonesia and the various Dayak cultures in this region.  Indonesian people are among the friendliest in the world, and it was a very special treat to spend our time immersed in this rich natural and cultural world.  Indonesia is developing rapidly, and while the days of the headhunters are long gone, seeing the cultural transformation of a people in such a short time is breathtaking.  I would highly recommend this trip for anyone; it was a rich and unforgettable experience.

reviews.title: Trip on Mahakam River
reviews.text: Trip up the Mahakam river, entering Dayak villages and visiting longhouses. Overnight stay at family home in Muara Muntai and in a floating house on the lake Malintang. All organised by tour guide Dennis (check DeDe Guesthouse Samarinda)

reviews.title: Local Weaving Village
reviews.text:
You can see villagers making fabrics by their traditional machine. You can also buy "kain tenun" from the maker itself. The price is relatively reasonable compare to the gift shop. They will tell if the fabric is tenun or not.

The location is equite hard to find. If you coming from the samarinda city, go toward samarinda seberang. After the bridge, turn left the go straight until you find big sign welcoming you to the "kampung tenun". Go straight until you find dark colored big house on the right. Park your car there, then go into the small alley beside that big house. You can find every house selling "kain tenun"

reviews.text: Pusat tenun sarung samarinda yang terkenal. Kita bisa melihat langsung proses pembuatan sarung serta belanja oleh - oleh disini

reviews.title: 展示館というには、、、
reviews.text: 伝統的な織物を展示、付近の家には、織機を操るお婆さんも。当日、豪雨で閉まっていたのですが、上半身裸の管理人らしき人が、案内して窓を開けて電気もつけてくれました。観光地の少ないサマリンダ、行ってみても良いかも、です。

reviews.title: belajar budaya
reviews.text: salah satu tempat yang bagus untuk belajar budaya indonesia yaitu menenun kain, kampungnya tidak terlalu bagus dan masih ada beberapa titik yang kurang diperhatikan kebersihannya.

reviews.title: Daerah Pengrajin Tenun Khas Samarinda
reviews.text: Kampung nya klasik, sunyi, jadi masih terdengar bunyi pengrajin yg sedang menenun dengan alat dari kayu (entah apa namanya) kerajinan manik-manik dengan motif dayak bisa juga di dapatkan murah disini. Untuk kain tenun masuk saja ke dalam gang nya. Harga yang di tawarkan lebih miring daripada bag depan,

reviews.title: tempat Wisata yang tidak menjual
reviews.text: Dipublish sebagai tujuan wisata khusus senin tenun, tetapi sangat tidak terlihat upaya untuk membuatnya dikunjungi wisatawan. kampung agak kumuh, sampah di beberapa titik. jika mau melihat orang membuat sarung( menenun) harus janjian dulu. tidak setiap hari ada orang menenun.

reviews.title: kearifan lokal khas samarinda
reviews.text: pertamakali kesini bareng teman-teman kampus untuk mata kuliah kebudayaan. saya banyak belajar budaya pembuatan sarung khas kota Samarinda. tempatnya di samarinda seberang.. alat tenunnya tradisional dan harga sarungnta relatif murah.

reviews.title: Wisata Bahari
reviews.text: Mengunjungi kampung tenun di Samarinda Seberang ini sangat bagus sekali. bisa sekalian beli sarung tenun khas Samarinda yang sudah terkenal.. harga relatif tdak terlalu mahal.. good..

reviews.title: kampung cikal bakal sarung Samarinda
reviews.text: kampungnya berada di Samarinda seberang, dinamakan kampung tenun karena disana lah asal muasal teknik menenun dan berkumpulnya komunitas penenun sarung Samarinda yang terkenal

reviews.title: seni banget
reviews.text: penduduk yang kreatif dengan mata pencaharaian penenun menggunakan alat tradisional tanpa bantuan mesin modern

name: Jessica Water Park
ranking_subcategory: #7 of 21 things to do in Samarinda
subcategory_ranking: #7 of 21 things to do in Samarinda
ranking: #7 of 21 things to do in Samarinda

address_obj.street2: Komp. Perum Pesona Mahakam, Harapan Baru

address: Jln. Pelita Komp. Perum Pesona Mahakam, Harapan Baru, Samarinda 75117 Indonesia

reviews.title: Lack of maintenance
reviews.text: It's very dissapointing, the water of the pool was very dirty, maybe the dirtiest pool I ever swam, the bathroom was dirty also and the shower was very weak and slow, made me very annoyed! I regretted to go there with my family.

reviews.title: cukup menarik
reviews.text: salah satu tempat wisata keluarga berisi kolam renang dengan aneka wahana air yang cukup lengkap. airnya tidak terlalu jernih tapi poin plusnya bisa melihat pemandangan sungai mahakam karena terletak di sebelah sungai mahakam.

reviews.title: Kolam Renang yang Cocok untuk Menjadi Tempat Berlibur
reviews.text: Kawasan yang luas dengan wahana yang lengkap menjadi daya tarik tersendiri untuk waterpark ini, sangat cocok bagi anda yang ingin mengajak keluarga seperti anak anak untuk berenang dan bermain di wahana wahana yang tersedia diwaterpark ini. Walaupun tempat nya agak jauh dari pusat kota dan harganya termasuk mahal tapi bakalan puas deh bermain air disini

reviews.title: Wahana Air yang bagus, sayang mahal
reviews.text: Gazebonya bisa di bilang terlalu mahal bagi kalangan anak muda. Untuk tiket masuk juga masih bisa dibilang tidak ramah di dompet.

reviews.title: Wahana Berman air untuk keluarga
reviews.text: Tempat berenang cocok untuk keluarga. Suasananya asri, kolamnya bermacam-macam. Disediakan free gazebo bagi yang tidak berenang. Sayangnya waktu kami kesana kolamnya sedang Kotor sedikit berlumut

reviews.title: Bersih dan nyaman
reviews.text: Berbagai macam wahana bisa dinikmati di wahana air jessica. Tempatnya juga bersih dan asri. Sangat cocok untuk keluarga yang sedang ingin refreshing

reviews.title: Bagus
reviews.text: Jessica ini salah satu tempat wisata air cukup populer di samarinda tapi sayang lokasinya jauh banget dari kota, harus menyeberangi jembatan mahakam yang kalau pagi dan sore macetnya udah parah banget. Tapi overall wahana asik2 cocok buat anak2 dan dewasa juga. Saya paling senang sama yang semacam sungai yang keliling semacam lazy rivernya waterboom bali tp masih kalah jauh sih ahaha. Tp ya lumayan untuk ukuran kota samarinda.

reviews.title: Wahana air di pinggir sungai Mahakam
reviews.text:
Lokasi sangat keren karena terletak di atas bukit dan bisa melihat sungai Mahakam dari kejauhan.
Wahana air rata-rata. Tidak ada yang menarik. Air tidak terlalu jernih

reviews.title: bagus
reviews.text: mantepp, wahana nya mengasikan, air nya bersih. kalo berenang disini recommended banget deh. tapi dari pusat kota sangat jauh ditempuh.

reviews.title: Wisata berenang keluarga
reviews.text: Lokasi di Samarinda seberang dalam komplek perumahan. Kolamnya besar dan ada luncuran juga. Ramai yang menunggu baskom besar menumpahkan air di atas kepala kita. Bagus untuk keluarga dengan anak kecil.

reviews.title: Swiming
reviews.text: Wahana dengan arena permainan yang cukup menantang adrenalin kalian. bahkan ada tempat bersantai dan beristirahat juga. cocok buat yang mau berlibur sekaligus bersantai ria

reviews.title: fasilitas mulai usang
reviews.text: lama kami ga kesini , ternayata banyak faslitas dan wahana yang harus dibenahi. tangga untuk prosotan juga banyak yang keropos dan membahayakan pengunjung yang rata rata anak anak. semoga pengelola segera membenahinya

reviews.title: Pengalaman yang tak terlupakan
reviews.text: Selalu menjadi memori yang diingat dan tak terlupakan. suasan yang sejuk dan pemandangan yang indah dan rasanya ingin tinggal disana.

name: Citra Niaga Market
ranking_subcategory: #19 of 21 things to do in Samarinda
subcategory_ranking: #19 of 21 things to do in Samarinda
ranking: #19 of 21 things to do in Samarinda
address: Jl. Niaga, Samarinda Indonesia

reviews.title: Souvenirs
reviews.text: Lot of souvenirs could be found here. You can bargain until the seller put the limit to the price. They are quite polite and very helpful

reviews.title: Citra Niaga
reviews.text: tempat jual cinderamata atau oleh oleh khas samarinda kalimantan timur.parkir luas suana nyaman dan bersih

reviews.title: Oleh ole
reviews.text: Open winkelcentrum met souvenierwinkeltjes en kleine straatrestaurants. Leuk als je op zoek bent naar een sarong, batik kleding, etuis en tasjes gedecoreerd met kleurige kralen. Veel sierraden.

reviews.title: Tua dan putus asa
reviews.text: Pernah Jaya di masanya, begitu cerita rekan kerja yang sudah berusia di kepala 5 menceritakan memori masa mudanya di akhir 80 atau awal 90 an mengenai tempat ini. Saat ini, tak ada hal istimewa yang ditawarkan tempat ini, hanya menyerupai kafetaria dan warung souvenir yang tidak terlampau istimewa. Mesti berbenah dan perlu didukung oleh pemerintah kota. Jangan biarkan sekarat dan mati tempat ini. Mesti dibuat daya tarik bagi pengunjung karena sebenarnya apa yang ditawarkan di sini tidaklah sama dengan sepuluhan tempat belanja modern di kota tepian ini.

reviews.title: Pusat Oleh2 Samarinda
reviews.text: Tempat anda mencari oleh2 khas Kalimantan Timur, manik2, baju/tas dayak, souvenir, batu, hiasan dan lain-lain. Sayang tempatnya sedikit kumuh dan kotor

reviews.title: Pasar souvenir khas kalimantan
reviews.text: Citra Niaga cocok untuk jalan-jalan belanja souvenir khas Kalimantan seperti kerajinan batu kalimantan, senjata tradisional, dan sarung samarinda. Tempat parkir panjang dan memadai.

reviews.title: Tempat Perbelanjaan Masa Lalu
reviews.text: Daerah Pusat Perbelanjaan Citra Niaga sudah melewati masanya. Sempat menjadi tempat yang populer dikunjungi oleh masyarakat lokal, namun dengan tidak adanya perkembangan sehingga menjadi daerah yang kusam. Seiring dengan kemajuan kota diikuti dengan Mall modern, maka daya tarik dan daya saing sudah sangat terpukul. Bila ada pembenahan yang menyeluruh maka dapat menarik pengunjung kembali

reviews.title: pusat oleh- oleh khas kaltim
reviews.text: nyari oleh-oleh khas kaltim disini lengkap, mudah dijangkau karena di pusat kota, arsitekturnya bagus tapi kurang perawatan, paling banyak di datangi orang untuk beli oleh-oleh

reviews.title: PUSAT PENJUALAN KERAJINAN KALIMANTAN YG TAK TERAWAT
reviews.text:
Salah satu pusat hiburan dan perbelanjaan pertama di kalimantan timur khususnya Kota samarinda. keadaannya kurang terawat dan kurang mendapat sentuhan dari pemerintah, terdapat beberapa toko yg menjual kerajinan khas kalimantan, toko elektronik, toko pakaian dan makanan,
jika bisa menawar maka kalian akan mendapatkan harga yg murah untuk barang kerajinan,
datanglah diantara jam 10:00 am s/d 05/pm

reviews.title: Tempat Penjualan Oleh - Oleh Khas Kalimantan
reviews.text: Saat Berkunjung Ke Pusat Citra Niaga Di Samarinda Banyak Tempat Penjualan Sovenir Khas kalimantan Dan Segalanya Ada Juga Terdapat Warung Kuliner Khas Samarinda Juga Ada Letaknya Mudah Dijangkau Dari Semua Jurusan Taxi Atau Ojek.

reviews.title: Tempat Beli Oleh-oleh Yang Lengkap
reviews.text: 19 Mei 2016, saya beli oleh-oleh di Pasar Citra Niaga, Samarinda.  Kiosnya sangat banyak, barang yang dijual sangat variasi ada kaos, souvenir, tas, hiasan dinding, dll.  Di sini saya beli kaos.  Tempatnya luas dan asyik buat belanja.

name: Islamic Center Samarinda Mosque
ranking_subcategory: #1 of 21 things to do in Samarinda
subcategory_ranking: #1 of 21 things to do in Samarinda
ranking: #1 of 21 things to do in Samarinda
address: Jl. Slamet Riyadi no. 1, Samarinda 75126 Indonesia

reviews.title: MUST PLACE TO GO
reviews.text: Islamic Center Samarinda is the one of the biggest islamic center in Asia. You can get the view of Mahakam River from it. Take a look the ambience of Samarinda here.

reviews.title: Mosque Biggest in Samarinda
reviews.text: Very clean inside and ouside, near from office Governor Kalimantan Timur. Front view mosque is river mahakam. Available mukena and sarong if you didn't have. Near from Mall Samarinda Central Plaza and Big Mall.

reviews.title: Beautiful building
reviews.text: the mosque complex is very big, large parking space, the mosque floor is huge, centrally located, open for public to pray from subuh to isya

reviews.title: Big nice but too many stairs
reviews.text:
Because the physical condition of my team (one of my friend was disabilitties on feet even didnt use wheelchair; and one again was too fat so too many stairs was made so exhausted, coz praying room were on the high floor. 
But its nice  place, cold floor like always mosque athmosphere.

reviews.title: Largest Mosque in Kalimantan
reviews.text: The largest and most magnificent mosque area in Kalimantan, unfortunately the garbage is still much scattered and the ablution place of women some distance away

reviews.title: Great architecture but I see a lot of garbage, so sad.
reviews.text: I went to Samarinda in late May for business trip, it was the beginning of fasting month (Ramadhan) for moslem. So, I went to this Islamic center for sightseeing. I was amazed with the great architecture. But unfortunately, the cleanliness is a minus point.

reviews.title: AMAZING BUILDING
reviews.text: been here when I'm going to Samarinda, the building was amazing. its so big and so beautiful. I took lot of pictures in here.

reviews.title: Second Largest Mosque In Southeast Asia
reviews.text: It is really awesome with 7 minarets. Completed in 2008 ,it is a mixed architecture of Turkey and other Middle east countries. There are elementary school, clinic, guest house, hall etc.

reviews.title: What a Mosque!
reviews.text: This is a very big mosque i think, it was really solid and nice, very clean and people also very polite here.

reviews.title: The biggest mosque in Samarinda
reviews.text: the location near the Mahakam river so the view is beautiful specially during sunset.the car park is big and the clinic is the next building but still in the same area

reviews.title: Beautiful mosque
reviews.text: One of the big mosque in Indonesia, beautiful and nice place to spend your time before or after praying time. You can see the river from the mosque and at night the light was so beautiful.

reviews.title: One of the most beautiful mosque in Indonesia
reviews.text: This Mosque is so stuning with its 99 metres towers. Enjoy the view at night from Mahakam river. Should be the icob of East Kalimantan Tourism.

reviews.title: Great spot and must visit!
reviews.text: Thought it was quite sometimes ago but I still clearly recall my first impression about this grand mosque. It is fantastic and beautiful mosque! If you are moslem you will miss the moment to do the daily praying there. Located perfectly towards the the famous Mahakam river, again, it's beautiful beautiful spot to visit in Samarinda!

reviews.title: Beautiful
reviews.text: One of Samarinda landmark places. Huge mosque in front of the Mahakam river. Even more beautiful at night (if) they turn on the lights

reviews.title: Worth Visiting
reviews.text: A Pleasant experience, very well maintained religious place. Its really an soulful experience to pray inside one of the greatest mosques. And I must say Islamic centre is one of the greatest places for praying and worth visiting to feel the soul of the Samarinda city. One can visit its Minaras and can have excellent picturesque views of the city.

reviews.title: Not just as Religion Tourism
reviews.text:
It's is the biggest mosque in East Kalimantan province, especially in Samarinda. 
1. Having beautiful architecture, decoration and details.
2. Easy accessibility and have great view because it's near from river side of Mahakam river. We can also use its "99 Asmaul Husna" Tower (minaret) to see around Samarinda City

reviews.title: The Best Islamic Center in Samarinda
reviews.text: Nice architecture, good location, big prayer room with detail ornament interior. You can pray anytime, because this masjid open for 24 hours.

reviews.title: Arabian taste in Samarinda
reviews.text: This mosque has a beautiful architecture, it's a cozy place to spend your afternoon. Located in Mahakam riverside.

reviews.title: Very big
reviews.text: It's certainly an impressive sight, especially from a distance, and close up it's monumental.  But there is a lack of signage so a visit without a guide can be bewildering and compared to some other large mosques in other countries it's not so interesting decoratively.

reviews.title: The Biggest Mosque in Borneo
reviews.text: If you go to Samarinda, East Kalimantan, Indonesia, you will find the bigest mosque as moslem doing pray and also place where you could search anything about Moslem there. It place also completed with integrated Islamic center that everyone could make discussion about Islamic science. This.place also provide converence hall for big seminar, meeting or gathering. This place also the precious icon that Samarinda has that should be visited by travelers.

name: BIG Mall
ranking_subcategory: #3 of 21 things to do in Samarinda
subcategory_ranking: #3 of 21 things to do in Samarinda
ranking: #3 of 21 things to do in Samarinda
description: BIG Mall is a stylish and modern shopping mall, strategically located on the bank of Mahakam river, Samarinda. Your New GREAT Lifestyle. Come & enjoy!
address: Jl. Untung Suropati no. 8, Samarinda 75126 Indonesia

reviews.title: Playground for children
reviews.text: One of the biggest mall in samarinda, located near mahakam river and mahakam bridge. Suit for bring children cause many playground provide here. This mall has XXI movie theather.

reviews.title: The biggest shopping center in samarinda
reviews.text: You can find many famous outlets in Big Mall like body shop, everbest, planet sports, donini, etc. You can find many famous restaurant too in Big Mall like pepper lunch, pizza hut, ichiban sushi, etc. I like the view, you can see mahakam river from the mall.

reviews.title: Great mall in samarinda
reviews.text:
One of the biggest shopping center in kalimantan.. you can find many famous outlets like samsung, everbest, charles & keith, body shop, starbucks, etc here.
It's crowded in weekend, the food counter will flooded with hoomans~
Located in the edge of mahakam river, don't forget to take your photos when the ship is sailed!

reviews.title: Big Mall with a small visitors
reviews.text: The mall located in the edge of mahakam river, very scenic and iconic. the newest Mall in Samarinda, on the contrary the visitors so minim even I visited here at Satuday afternoon.

reviews.title: Still some empty spaces
reviews.text:
This big mall, just like it's name, still have some of empty space. But overall this mall will served you all you need.

My visit this time with my new baby. Having no elevator/lift made us difficult because we use stroller.

reviews.title: Bigest mall in east of indonesia
reviews.text: This mall is big, for east indonesia this is very big. Have good brand store and many restaurant. Have hypermart, sogo, matahari etc

reviews.title: Most classy mall in town
reviews.text:
If you look for a mall with branded stuffs and famous restaurants, i would recommend this one. Even though there are still many stores that are not opened yet, but still they have other good stores to visit. 
What i like to visit here are Starbucks, XXI cinemas, and other restaurants

reviews.title: Big mall
reviews.text:
Huge hyper market with varieties of branded items and shops. Varieties of restaurants. 
Goods are cheap. Place is very clean and modern concept. It is a must visit place if you are Samarinda.

reviews.title: Cozy Mall in Samarinds
reviews.text:
You can find anything inside Big Mall. Layout and stores seems like central park or Taman Anggrek in Jakarta.

Many brand stores, famous resto and coffee shop inside this mall.

Visitor can enjoy the View of Mahakam River on balcony mall near solaris resto.

reviews.title: A good mall to shop around
reviews.text: Value for money stores and good variety of restaurants offers taste o varied cuisines. Very good crowd mostly youngsters. Good quality stores and restaurants

reviews.title: Big.. but Less Hospitality
reviews.text: That's right if every one talk about this shopping center as the biggest one in Samarinda. But, after more than 2 years opening, this mall is still less to add any facilities, especially lift and zonation map, so we have to walk and walk blindly from one part to another in this big. BUT OVERALL, THIS MALL IS THE MOST ADORABLE AND ENJOYABLE MALL IN THE CITY. It's good enough to make you enjoy your hang out time with every relationship you have.

reviews.title: Still nothing
reviews.text: Well this big mall, looks huge same as the name of it. Well usually if u wanted to find food theres something there but ummm i not advicing u guys to go there cause it so boring

reviews.title: Big but with plenty empty space
reviews.text: This mall is, just like its name, BIG. Plenty of food and shopping choice. Hypermart, SOGO, Matahari, Amazon game center, Solaria, KFC and many more. But it seems unfinished with some of empty store. The potential to become the center of East Kalimantan shopping center is big. Just like its name.

reviews.title: New choice for shopping
reviews.text: Two things i love from BIG Mall is their tenants and their Mahakam view. They serve a different brands of tenants which is new in Samarinda (other malls doesn't have it). Wish they'll have more exciting brands in future!

reviews.title: Big and Cozy
reviews.text:
Having short trip with family, went there for a while and seeking many things to buy.
Various shop and the most attractive are various stand for snack corner. You can seek and choose anything you need.
The parking area also quite big.

reviews.title: Developing
reviews.text: The place is new and developing. Still half mall is empty. Need to go up a few levels to feel the activies in the mall

reviews.title: New mall in town
reviews.text: It's a brand new mall and the construction is still in progress.. the tenants are quite the same.. however there are more international-food-based cafe in here.

reviews.title: It seem like the biggest mall at East Kalimantan
reviews.text: New mall at Samarinda, when we first arrive, it seem very quite, when when go around, the mall was just full of people. I have got the change to purchase/try the stores there. However, it seem well design mall with some of the best brand available. It seem like the biggest mall at East Kalimantan, located near Mahakam river.

reviews.title: The most okay mall in town!
reviews.text:
This mall is located along the Mahakam river,near the big bridge. There are many shops and boutiques for clothes and shoes as well as a supermarket. There are movie theaters too. Children can play in the amusement center as well. 
A couple of fastfood, local restos and other asia restos can be found here.
Some units are still empty. There's a Starbucks coffee shop in the second building..Well probably thats the best thing in this mall :)

reviews.title: Big Mall
reviews.text: Just a big shopping palace with Cinema , clothes food electronics all there. Prices are are not high and not cheap  ☺☺☺☺☺☺☺☺☺☺☺☺☺☺😅😅

reviews.title: Park for runners
reviews.text: It's the only park worth visiting in the city, especially for runners. Luckily the park is only a few kilometers from my hotel. Nothing else to do here but walk or run around it, through the path inside or the streets outside.

reviews.title: Taman Silaturahmi
reviews.text: Taman Samarendah, sebagi arena hijau di tengah kota menjadi alternatif  masyarakat melakukan kegiatan positif apa saja. Saya pernah melakukan kegiatan Literasi, mengajak  1000anak sekolah di Samarimnda untuk Membaca Nyaring Bersama . Saya juga  mengadakan kegiatan  Bermain di luar Ruang bersama anak anak dan juga Kegiatan Mendongeng bersama Kampung Dongeng dan Anak Rumah tahfidz

reviews.title: Bagus sih
reviews.text:
Plus:  Lampu warna warni, air, patung n tower menjadi spot yg baik untuk dinikmati pada waktu malam hari
Minus: sekitar taman sangat gelap, kurang tempat duduk dan sulit menemukan tempat sampah

address: Samarinda 75112 Indonesia

reviews.title: First mall in Samarinda
reviews.text: Crowded place.......crowded road.......in the middle of city...... Close to central market...... Difficult to get parking..... Just try another place........

reviews.title: Pioneer
reviews.text: Merupakan Pusat perbelanjaan pertama yg hadir di ibukota Kalimantan Timur, Samarinda. Berada di Kawasan sibuk, Jl. K.H Khalid, bersisian dengan pasar pagi yang ramai. Anchor tenant nya yg terkenal dahulu saat berkunjung ke Pusat perbelanjaan ini adalah Hero supermarket, yg sekarang berganti menjadi Giant.

reviews.title: Mall tua
reviews.text: Ya ini merupakan mall pertama di samarinda, udah pernah kebakaran 3 kali kalau tidak salah tetapi selalu di bangun kembali. Lokasinya di dekat pasar pagu sehingga lokasinya bener2 macet jika ingin kesini crowded banget dah. Saya rasa mall ini udah mulai tertinggal seiring adanya mall2 baru semacm lembus,PM, SCP dan yang paling hits Big Mall.

reviews.title: Tertua & terbaik di masanya
reviews.text: Salah satu pusat perbelanjaan terbesar dan tertua di samarinda. tapi sekarang agak berkurang minat nya, karena banyak mall-mall yang lebih bagus dan fasilitas yang memadai

reviews.title: Mall Pertama di Samarinda
reviews.text: Menurut warga sekitar dan sahabat saya, mall ini adalah mall pertama disamarinda. Letaknya ditengah tengah pasar pagi, sangat ramai, dan banyak barang yang dijual disini. Bangunannya lebih terlihat seperti kantor dari pada mall.

name: Tanah Merah Waterfall
ranking_subcategory: #21 of 21 things to do in Samarinda
subcategory_ranking: #21 of 21 things to do in Samarinda
ranking: #21 of 21 things to do in Samarinda
address: Ds Purwasari, Samarinda Indonesia

reviews.title: Peaceful
reviews.text: Out site from the Samarinda about 45 minutes from the city. You could get there by the taxy or ojeg. You will find peaceful place there with a lot of trees surround the waterfall. Little bit dirty with garbage at some angle but its okey for traveler visit.

reviews.title: Tiny super tiny
reviews.text: Nothing nice, super tiny waterfall.. Dont expect anything.. Just a small water come out of rock. Thats it

reviews.title: Water fall
reviews.text: It's was waterfall......with beautiful scene .......till the ruined it..... Now water is dark coz there are mine on the upstream side......  So sad to Samarinda gov for not maintain the nature n environment.......

reviews.title: It's not waterfall
reviews.text: When I went to this place I though I can see beautiful waterfall but when I arrived I'm looking for the waterfall and shock when I saw it. It's not waterfall but just water falling from the stone.

reviews.title: Tidak terawat
reviews.text:
Miris liat kondisi nya saat ini sangat tidak terawat, beda dengan 20 tahun yang lalu..

reviews.title: Tanah Merah Waterfall
reviews.text: Air terjun Tanah Merah yang berada di jalan yang mengarah ke Kota Bontang ini merupakan salah satu air terjun favorit di kalangan pecinta jalan-jalan di wilayah Samarinda dan sekitarnya. Air terjun ini meskipun tidak terlalu tinggi tapi hawa sejuk terasa ketika kita sampai di air terjun ini. Untuk mencapai lokasi ini saya sarankan untuk memakai kendaraan pribadi karena angkutan umum hanya sampai jalan besar yang mengarah ke Bontang dan masuknyapun masih lumayan jauh. Saat itu sekitar tahun 2014 tiket masuk sekitar Rp.10.000,-. Di lokasi juga terdapat beberapa warung yang menjajakan makanan serta gazebo untuk beristirahan serta juga ada fasilitas mushola dan toilet. Happy traveling.

reviews.title: Learning Buddhism?? Here Is The Place
reviews.text:
This is a Buddhist Theravada temple that was built 25 years ago and such a suitable place to those who wants to learn Buddhism since there is a monk lives in the temple for most of the time. 

Located behind Budi Bhakti school, there might be a lot of people coming on Sunday for practicing Dhamma, and there will be a ritual for preparing food for breakfast and lunch to the Monks.

This temple is pretty clean, and there is a meditation room at the back of the area. Not everyone can enter this place, but if you wish, please ask the guard or the worker for permissions. 

It is a must to wear proper clothing when come to this place (no shorts, no sleeveless), and for tourist, please make a call to get the information before coming, in case there is a ceremony and the temple is not ready to take a guest.

Taman yang kini banyak di hiasi lampion kala malam ini dan beberapa wahana permainan anak juga tersedia disini. Selain dekat taman ini juga mudah sekali di jangkau karena banyak angkot yang meklewati jalur ini. Selamat menikmati keindahan kerlip lampion kala malam berkunjung ke taman ini.

reviews.title: Tempat bersantai yang ramai di malam hari
reviews.text:
Umumnya tempat ini akan menjadi lokasi kuliner yang didominasi oleh camilan-camilan ringan sambil bersantai menikmati malam di pinggiran sungai Mahakam. Namun tidak satu pun penganan lokal yang saya temui, melainkan lebih ke arah modifikasi penganan daerah lain, seperti pisang epe Makassar yang di sini dimodifikasi dengan menggunakan kuah yang lebih cair dan menggenang, atau roti bakar dan lain sebagainya. Namun untuk bersantai sambil bercengkrama dengan kerabat, mungkin tempat ini bisa dicoba, sekaligus merasakan atmosphere lokal masyarakat muda-mudi kota Samarinda di malam hari.
Untuk harga makanan masih dapat dikatakan bersahabat. Satu informasi, sebagian besar minuman yang disajikan berasal dari minuman instan seperti kopi sachets dan sejenisnya.

reviews.title: Unwanted Visit
reviews.text:
Never interested with Lampion Garden Samarinda and never have a plan to go there but one festival/show that make me want to go there, it called Samarinda Coffee Festival or Borneo Coffee Fest. You have to pay 15.000/pax (I don't know how much it cost in regular days) to enter this Lampion Garden. 
So, already enter this unwanted spot in Samarinda... Precisely what I've been thinking about this place, it's to expensive just to enter this constantly, consistently, unchanging Lampions.. you know what I mean.. from the 1st time it opened the Lampions is just the same. 
But hey c'mon, there's a lot of joyful ride like in the carnival.. yes they have rides/games but i have to pay more to enjoy every ride they provide there.
So, this place is wonderful for you that never been to this place or you that for the first time visiting Samarinda and want to have instagramable picture.

reviews.title: Genius Idea for Object Tourism
reviews.text: Menurut saya, objek wisata lampion ini merupakan ide yang sangat cemerlang dalam memanfaatkan lahan di sisi Sungai Mahakam. Hal ini juga dapat menjadi hiburan bagi warga kota Samarinda sekaligus taman kota. Wisata lampion ini baik di malam hari. Terdapat banyak karakter kartun dan juga landmark kota di Dunia seperti menara Eiffel. Wisata lampion ini tentunya merupakan wisata kekinian untuk berfoto. Namujn jangan lupa untuk membawa kamera yang bagus agar hasilnya memusakan.

reviews.title: Taman Lampion

reviews.title: Best Place in Samarinda
reviews.text:
Mahakam Lampuon Garden adalah taman lampion yang berada tepat di tepi sungai Mahakam. 
Taman ini selain berisi banyak lampion yang beraneka rupa, juga ada banyak permainan untuk anak2 & dewasa. 
Tempat yang sangat cocok untuk dikunjungi bersama keluarga atau teman2 untuk berfoto2, maupun menghabiskan waktu untuk bermain & makan.

reviews.title: One of the most visited mall in Samarinda
reviews.text:
Despite many malls have been built in Samarinda recently, this mall still is one of the most visited mall in Samarinda.
XXI and 21 cinema make this mall famous among teenagers. Because from what I know, Samarinda Central Plaza(SCP) is the only mall that has cinema and located in the middle of the town center.
SCP also has a department store that is quite big in Samarinda, alongside Matahari Department Store, called Ramayana Department Store. They offer goods with prices cheaper than Matahari Department Store. But I personally prefer Matahari Department Store. Although if you're looking for school shoes, I would say Ramayana.
SCP has bookstore named Karisma. The price offered is quite cheap.
At the top floor there are a karaoke place called Happy Puppy and a chinese restaurant called Ong Palace.
And like any other mall, this mall ha fun centers for family and kids, called Fun City and Amazon. Since I was liittle, I always loved to come and play here. Because there were so many variety of games. It was so hard to get bored in here!

reviews.title: Not the best place to visit
reviews.text:
We did a 4d3n tour to kutai national park with De Gigant tours in September 2022. 

Our guide, Rastam, was very kind, generous and efficient. I would recommend him.

Our low rating is more about the trip itself. As with many trips in borneo, the 4d, 3n description isn’t particularly accurate. You spend 1.5 days in Kutai national park, 2 days travelling. Kutai national park is not particularly beautiful and the jungle is not in great condition. We did see three wild orangutans, but no other wildlife. 

The motor canoe is a brief trip (1hr) up a local river to spot crocodiles. There is plenty of rubbish in the river and will only see crocodiles if the tide is right. 

The research station is newly built, simple, but clean. It is worth noting that there is only electricity from mid afternoon until 11:30pm, so sleeping can be challenging in the heat and the middle of the day was quite intense. Thee is no fridge or ice on the premises. Food was very basic. 

The hotel in Samarinda on the final night was quite nice.

All in all, we wished we had spent more time elsewhere as we experienced much better jungle elsewhere.

reviews.title: Jungle travel not as expected,
reviews.text:
We (father/daughter and her friend) did the 9 days Mahakan Soul travel 11th till 19 th of march 2016 with  De Gigant Tours Borneo /Lucas Zwaal.
we didn't get what was promised, and were very disappointed when we refer to the amount of money we payed for an expected experience:
-we did a prepayment and had to pay the rest of de money cash to the guide.....;.
-we didn't get the canoe sailing and the dinner the first day;   
-we didn't get Dayak hunting; the guide was even not good eguiped in the jungle,
-we got the adress from lonely planet. We think lonely planet (2013) has to stop their advice because of the problems with this organisation: no life jacket with sailing on the wild river with ces and no good preparation for health condition in the jungle. we have said that Lucas Zwaal should have to informe him with Kiri Travel our good jungle experience the week before. I didn't get the idea that he will take his measures in this way......

reviews.text: Taman Nasional Kutai, adalah salah satu hutan konservasi yang terletak di pertengahan Bontang-Sangatta. Jika kita masuk ke dalam. Pertama Kita akan melewati jembatan kayu, dan jembatan gantung sebelum akhirnya melewati jalan setapak untuk awal petualangan. Kita akan berada didalam hutan selama 3 jam, dengan menyuguhkan alam yang luar biasa. Akan ada banyak atraksi di dalam nya. Mulai dari rumah puhon yang tinggi banget, ada air terjun bidadari, ada jembatan satu tali dan lain-lain. Jadi kalau kalian berkunjung ke Kalimantan Timur, Jangan lupa datang Ke Taman Nasional Kutai

The best conditions are found only in the ground floor and the basement because there are plenty fast-food restaurants and a large chain-store supermarket.

The destination purposed to this mall is currently only for dining, and eat, not for other needs.

reviews.title: A mall with imported goods
reviews.text:
When I still live in Samarinda, I sometimes visited this mall. My mother liked to do grocery shop at the Hypermart that is located in this mall.
I would say that the overall design of this mall is neat.The shops were strategically styled, so no shop was being 'left out'. Most of the shops that I've seen there are mostly shops that sell imported stuff and shops that already have famous brands. That's why most of the price are quite expensive.
I would suggest to shop your wardrobe at Matahari Department Store. If you're smart and patience enough to search for discounts or promo, you will get the best deal at Matahari.

reviews.title: Desa budaya pampang
reviews.text: Jika kita sedang berada dikota samarinda, sempat kan watu untuk mengunjungi desa budaya pampang, desa ini merupakan salah satu kawasan desa budaya dayak disana kita bisa melihat kehidupan suku dayak, rumah2 tradisional dan pakaian adat tradisional juga ada tari tarian adat suku dayak, pemandangan etnis dayak sangat kental disini.

reviews.title: Sepi
reviews.text: Padahal ini tempat kumplit untuk oleh oleh dibawa pulang...sayang harganya sedikit lebih mahal dan harus bayar tunai yang kebetulan k kredit hanya bisa salah satu bank saja...lain waktu tolong dibuat menarik supaya lebih maju lagi dibuat menarik

reviews.title: Koleksi Lengkap, Tapi Harganya Agak Mahal
reviews.text: 19 Mei 2016, saya beli oleh-oleh di UKM Center Samarinda.  Oleh-oleh yang dijual sangat beragam ada souvenir, kaos, tas, dompet, hiasan sampai makanan.  Harga tidak perlu menawar, tapi saya rasa harganya agak mahal.

reviews.title: membeli oleh oleh
reviews.text: anda dapat membeli oleh-oleh dari samarinda di tempat ini. tidak jauh dari kawasan perkotaan. dan harga terjangkau.

reviews.title: Tempat Oleh-Oleh Terlengkap
reviews.text: Saya mengunjungi UKM center ini ketika di Samarinda atas rekomendasi driver. tempat ini menjual banyak souvenir, kerajinan, dan makanan khas kalimantan khususnya kaltim. saya membeli kain khas kalimantan dan amplang. karena disini banyak macam amplang. cukup lengkap.

name: East Kalimantan Center Oleh-Oleh Khas Kaltim
ranking_subcategory: #2 of 9 Shopping in Samarinda
subcategory_ranking: #2 of 9 Shopping in Samarinda
ranking: #2 of 9 Shopping in Samarinda
description: One Stop Shopping, Craft and Souvenir from East Kalimantan
address: Jln. Pangeran Antasari 1 Next To Happy Puppy, Samarinda 75127 Indonesia

reviews.title: Completely different than described
reviews.text: I went there to search for east kalimantan souvenirs real quick and i could say it was a dissapointing experience. There was no one to help me as i look around helplessly and everywhere i look it was very dusty. Price wise it was also pretty expensive for a store that looks like no one has ever been going in a decade.

reviews.title: Delicious Roti Durian
reviews.text:
They have many east kalimantan souvenirs like beads jewelry, original gemstone, and bag, purse, wooden craft, keychain, dolls tshirt, until kaltim chips, amplang and many more. Also roti durian which is SO DELICIOUS! 
The place is cozy and elegant. Service is good. You will feel you are in kaltim here 😍

reviews.title: impressive service affordable price
reviews.text: Truly impressed with EKC reliability when I was in pinch of shopping at night. Great range of local delicacies selections, they even have the famous roti duren panglima. Good quality and affordable price. wonderful!

reviews.title: one place for all souvenirs in Samrinda
reviews.text: the good place and good price to visit for souvenirs,a lot of local handy craft,t shirt,local food etc.only the parking area need more space

reviews.title: All you need from Samarinda
reviews.text:
This shop is well know in Samarinda.
It has everything East Kalimantan you can possibly think of.
Souvenirs, snacks even the famous durian bread.
They also have their wall of celebrities :)
So, if you don't have time to go to the traditional market, this shop is a must.
It's a one stop shop for your souvenirs.

reviews.title: Shop n Go
reviews.text: Best place to shop for souvenirs. You will find traditional Dayak handicraft, beads necklaces, famous Borneo gemstones, Borneo batiks, t-shirts, and local snacks. You will find almost everything here to bring to your loved ones with a very reasonable price. If you bought plenty and fragile items, they will also provide good packaging for you.

reviews.title: Oleh oleh kaltim
reviews.text:
Tempat oleh oleh lengkap di samarinda.
Dengan pelayanan yang ramah...
Setiap tour kalimantan selalu tamu kami ajak mampir kesini

reviews.title: Ada Rumah Makan juga
reviews.text: Selain Oleh oleh yang berupa Souvenir dan snack, ternyata ada warung makan juga dengna bernagai variasi menu yang cukup populer di lidah warga samatinda

reviews.title: Oleh oleh Palangkaraya
reviews.text: Setiap ibu kota yg ada bandara / airport nya, pasti akan dikunjungi wisatawan, dan pada akhirnya mencari souvenir & oleh oleh , tapi di palangkaraya,. JANGAN PERNAH MEMBELI snack di bandaranya,. Harganya super ,. kalau di pasar pasar & toko membeli snack (ikan seluang =contoh) bisa 30 -50 ribu,. di bandara harganya 100 -125 ribu,. bahkan dengan kondisi setelah dibuka ( sudah kurang baik), dan dg pelayanan yg cuex bebek, .minimnya pembinaan dr pemerintah bagaimana memajukan wisata dari segi Souvenir dan kulinary... sepertinya harus dikembangkan

reviews.title: Aneka jajanan dan oleh oleh
reviews.text: Amplang atau kuku macan merupakan maanan khas daerah kalimantan timur, mempunyai ciri khas dengan rasanya, juga banyak oleh oleh lainnya.

reviews.title: Beli oleh-oleh
reviews.text: Tempatnya cukup lengkap untuk cari oleh oleh khas Kaltim khususnya Samarinda saya sering kesini biasa untuk beli oleh2 buat keluarga

reviews.title: Lokasi strategis
reviews.text: Lokasi strategis dan mudah ditemukan, barang-barang nya cukup lengkap dengan berbagai jenis oleh-oleh mulai dari makanan sampai kain dan souvenir dan harga nya terjangkau.

reviews.title: Pusat oleh-oleh
reviews.text: Bagi wisatawan yang berkunjung ke samarinda wajib mampir ke sini jika mencari oleh-oleh untuk dibawa pulang, tempatnya mudah dicari dan dijangkau..

reviews.title: Tempat beli oleh2 lengkap dan menyenangkan
reviews.text: Sudah 2 kali saya berbelanja di tempat ini, wowww, tempat yang mungil dan strategis dengan pilihan oleh2 khas Kalimantan Timur yang cukup lengkap. Berbagai jenis kerajinan dan makanan tersedia, Roti Durian Panglima kesukaan saya pun ada disini. Harganya dijamin murah meriah deh...

reviews.title: Kemarin sudah bolak balik 3 kali
reviews.text: Sampai bolak balik karna saya membandingkan harga lempok haha. Ternyata jauh lebih murah di sini... Wah emang udah langganan sih sebelum ke jogja pasti belanja ke sini :)

reviews.title: pusat oleh oleh khas kaltim
reviews.text: koleksi oleh-olehnya lengkap, lokasinya di pusat kota, nyaman dijangkau, harga ekonomis, pelayanan cukup bagus, selain souvenir khas kalimantan ada juga jajanannya

reviews.title: 1 stop shopping
reviews.text: Senang berbelanja disini... lengkappp g perlu kemana2 lg klo mau bawa sodara atau tmn yg mau cari souvenir atau cemilan khas samarinda..... cukup di satu tmpt....

reviews.title: Tempat oleh-oleh
reviews.text: Saya diberitahu oleh teman saya dan diajak kesini buat beli oleh oleh...hasilnya yah saya beli amplang dll buat dijadikan oleh oleh..sayang harus cash katanya dia gak bisa aksesin gesek debit bca..

reviews.title: Toko amplang di samarinda
reviews.text: Amplang merk Mawar Indah dijual disini. Selain itu jg menjual berbagai macam makanan khas Samarinda. Tdp juga pernak pernik Khas Kalimantan dgn harga terjangkau.

reviews.title: Semua ada
reviews.text: Jika mencari oleh-oleh di satu tempat dengan berbagai pilihan, semua ada disini. Roti durian panglima, amplang, snacks, kaos dan cindera mata lain. Konon harga roti durian lebih murah daripada yang dijual di luar karena ini adalah tempat asal roti tersebut.

reviews.title: Late nite visit
reviews.text: Nice place for hangout with the gangs...... Late nite visit will be best time........ Weekend will be lil bit crowded ..... But sometimes it's good to be in the crowd

reviews.title: Wisata malam
reviews.text: Lebih cocok bagi wisatawan bujangan atau bisnis kolega. tidak dianjurkan untuk anak dibawah umur dan anak sekolah.

reviews.title: hiburan malam yang ada di Samarinda
reviews.text: setiap minggu selalu ada artis Ibukota datang kesini untuk ngisi acara, tempat dugem anak2 muda Samarinda

reviews.title: Hiburan mantap di Samarinda!!
reviews.text: Tempat ini adalah salah satu tempat hiburan ternyaman di samarinda, apalagi pada saat malam minggu yang dimana banyak orang ke tempat ini

reviews.title: tempat hiburan malam yg terkenal
reviews.text: pelayanan kurang, terkadang memilih milih, area kotor, karna tidak langsung di bersihkan, terkadang banyak tisu dan puntung rokok berhamburan, dari segi harga cukup bersaing, crowded banget di malam malam tertentu,

reviews.title: refreshing
reviews.text: tempat hiburan untuk menyegarkan otak dan juga harga tidak terlalu mahal dan pelayanannya pun juga cukup ramah

reviews.title: suasana mantap !
reviews.text: menghabiskan malam di kota ini? tempat ini bisa dijadikan salah satu rekomendasi tempat yang oke.. makanan oke, interior ruangan bagus, lighting mantap!

reviews.title: Interesting Club's
reviews.text: Aku merasa puas dugem di tempat hiburan malam ini. Ada live DJ, musiknya OK, makanan+minuman OK and ladiesnya cantik2 euy. Club's ini letaknya strategis di pusat kota jalan Panglima Batur Samarinda.

reviews.title: Bisa liat view kota samarinda dengan leluasa
reviews.text: Gak perlu waktu lama dan stamina yang kuat, trackingnya pendek aja, cuman itungan menit. Ada beberapa spot selfie yang bisa di pilih dan gratis, gak ada biaya tambahan. View kota samarinda akan terlihat dari kejauhan dan menunggu sunset merupakan momen terbaik yang saya rekomendasikan

name: ZEN Family Spa & Reflexology
description: ZEN Family Spa & Reflexology offers an exclusive selection of treatments featuring techniques and ingredients that reflect traditional Balinese approaches, employing gifts of nature including silken oils, soothing fragrances, and lush vegetation. This sublime convergence of local ancient and modern-day ZEN products gives guests a true appreciation of beauty and mysticism of the Balinese culture.
